questions.question: Is the stylized "P" logo with a cart-like shape and circular wheel present on the surface of both tarts?
questions.explanation: In Image B, there is only one tart visible with a stylized 'P' logo on the surface. There is no evidence of a second tart to compare against, so the assessment is solely based on the single tart. In a comparison with Image A, Image B would be different since Image A shows two tarts, but for Image B alone, only one tart has the logo.

questions.question: Is the word "PABLO" written in uppercase letters beneath the logo on both tarts?
questions.explanation: In Image B, the word 'PABLO' is observed below the stylized 'P' logo on the single visible tart. As before, since Image B displays only one tart, there is no second tart for comparison. Reflecting on the comparisons with Image A isnâ€™t necessary for the current state in Image B.

questions.question: Does the top surface of each tart display a bright yellow layer covering most of the surface?
questions.explanation: In Image B, the single tart displayed prominently shows a bright yellow layer covering the majority of its top surface. Due to the absence of a second tart in Image B, the determination for both tarts is not possible. In contrast, Image A depicts two tarts with bright yellow surfaces.

questions.question: Is there a visible white creamy filling beneath the yellow top layer in both tarts, especially in the sliced portion?
questions.explanation: Image B, containing just one whole tart without any slicing, cannot reveal the internal filling as the edited image does not display a sliced portion, unlike Image A. Thus, there's no visible white creamy filling directly observed.

questions.question: Does the crust of both tarts exhibit a golden-brown color with a flaky, uneven edge?
questions.explanation: In the single tart from Image B, the crust shows a golden-brown color with a flaky and uneven edge. Since Image B presents only one tart, an assessment of both tarts' crusts is not feasible. In contrast, Image A depicts two tarts with the described crust feature.

questions.question: Is the rear tart partially sliced to reveal the internal cross-section of the filling and crust?
questions.explanation: In Image B, only one tart is depicted, and it is whole without any slicing to show a cross-section. The situation differs from Image A, where the rear tart is indeed sliced. In Image B, no such feature is visible.

questions.question: Is the whole tart positioned in front of the partially sliced tart, with the latter slightly elevated and angled toward the back?
questions.explanation: In Image B, there is only a single tart, so there is no arrangement with a whole tart in front and a sliced tart in the back. Contrast to Image A, where such positioning is evident, Image B lacks this spatial arrangement, displaying a singular tart in an outdoor scene.
